articles.author: James Mackenzie
articles.description: Hezbollah and Israel seemed content to let Sunday's attack, in retaliation for the killing of a senior Hezbollah commander in Beirut last month, count as settled for the moment.
articles.title: Israel says situation on Lebanon border 'not sustainable'

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Ramadan Abed
articles.description: Israel issued new evacuation orders for Deir Al-Balah in the central Gaza Strip late on Sunday, forcing more families to flee, saying forces intended to act against militant group Hamas and others operating in the area.
articles.title: Families flee after new Israeli evacuation orders in Gaza as ceasefire hopes dim

articles.author: Pavel Polityuk, Gleb Garanich
articles.description: The sound of explosions rang out in central Kyiv on Monday morning during rush hour as Ukraine's military warned of a massive Russian missile and drone attack following waves of drone attacks in the early hours.
articles.title: Russia launches massive missile and drone attack on Ukraine, Kyiv says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Five Palestinians were killed in an Israeli strike on the Nur Shams refugee camp in the West Bank on Monday, the Palestinian health ministry said in a statement.
articles.title: Five killed in Israeli strike on West Bank camp, Palestinian health ministry says

articles.author: Saleem Ahmad, Saud Mehsud
articles.description: Separatist militant attacks on police stations, railway lines and highways in Pakistan's restive province of Balochistan, coupled with retaliatory operations by security forces, killed at least 51 people, officials said on Monday.
articles.title: More than 50 killed after militant attacks in Pakistan's Balochistan

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The Brazilian health sanitary agency Anvisa has been informed of a suspected case of mpox at the country's main international airport near Sao Paulo, it said in a statement on Monday.
articles.title: Brazil reports suspected mpox case at Sao Paulo airport

articles.author: James Oliphant
articles.description: Republican presidential candidate Donald Trump used the third anniversary on Monday of the U.S. withdrawal from Afghanistan to try to pin the chaotic pullout on his Democratic rival for the White House, Kamala Harris.
articles.title: Trump tries to tie rival Harris to chaotic Afghanistan exit

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: At least one person died and five could still be under the rubble after a Russian missile struck a civilian infrastructure building in the central Ukraine city of Kryvyi Rih, regional officials said on Tuesday.
articles.title: Russia's attack on Kryvyi Rih kills at least one, Ukrainian officials say

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Three men have been arrested on suspicion of setting fires that have destroyed thousands of hectares of sugarcane plantations in northern Sao Paulo state, its Governor Tarcisio de Freitas said on Monday.
articles.title: Three arson suspects arrested for setting fires in Brazil farmland

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: U.S. President Joe Biden and Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Monday discussed the war in Ukraine and their shared commitment to working towards peace and prosperity in the Indo-Pacific, the White House said in a statement.
articles.title: Biden, India's Modi discuss Ukraine war, Indo-Pacific, U.S. says
